issue.title: [R] arrowExports.cpp generation changed with glue package 1.5.1
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-15049](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15049). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
When rendering arrowExports.cpp, if the latest glue release is installed (version 1.5.1), we get a huge diff. I imagine that we should update the generation script to render the previous version or somebody should commit the version with updated glue to avoid the file getting updated by too many PRs?

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15049?focusedCommentId=17456723) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
I don't see anything in glue's changelog that suggests that there was an intended change in behavior. Do you want to file an issue over there?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15049?focusedCommentId=17458367) by Dewey Dunnington (paleolimbot):*
Done! https://github.com/tidyverse/glue/issues/247

(but also found an easy workaround in the process, hence the PR)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15049?focusedCommentId=17458596) by Jonathan Keane (jonkeane):*
